original: GYULENHOFF, Carl Axel Henrik, Diplom-ingenjör, Lidingö, f Gunnarsnäs, Älvsb l, 28/8 00 av öv.ljt A G o Helena Halling, gm Anna-Hanna Brandorf. Studex Halmstad 20, diploming Techn Hochsch Darmstadt (pappers- o cellul.tekn) 24. Prakt öl sv pappers-o cellul.fabr 15—24, konstr AB Karlstads Mek Verkst 25—27, ing AB Delthirna o Leje & Thurne AB 28—42, uppbyggt o org samt förest sistn fmas tekn avd 32—42, byråchef i Statens Bränslekommission 43 (byrån f ersättningsbränslen). Löjtn Sjövärnskåren. Äger villa -fastigh Lidingö. Resor: Prakt tag hela Europa 28—42 flera gånger årl (därav 7 långres i bil). Sthlms Friv Motorb.flott ftjts ef t 10 års akt delt i friv försv.arb, skyttemg. Hobbies: All sport, företrädesvis motorbåts- o bil-, konstintresse.
translated: GYULENHOFF, Carl Axel Henrik, Diplom Engineer, Lidingö, born in Gunnarsnäs, Älvsborgs län, on August 28, 1900, son of Lieutenant Colonel A. G. and Helena Halling. Married to Anna-Hanna Brandorf. Completed secondary education in Halmstad in 1920, received diploma from Technische Hochschule Darmstadt (paper and cellulose technology) in 1924. Worked as a trainee in Swedish paper and cellulose factories from 1915-1924, served as a construction engineer at AB Karlstads Mekaniska Verkstad from 1925-1927, engineer at AB Delthirna and Leje & Thurne AB from 1928-1942, responsible for building and organizing the technical department from 1932-1942. Bureau chief at the State Fuel Commission from 1943 (responsible for alternative fuels). Lieutenant in the naval reserves. Owns a residential property in Lidingö. Traveled extensively throughout Europe from 1928-1942, making several annual trips (including 7 long-distance trips by car). Active member of the Stockholm Volunteer Motorboat Fleet for 10 years, participated in voluntary defense work and shooting exercises. Hobbies: All kinds of sports, particularly motorboating and cars, interest in art.

career.workplace: AB Delthirna and Leje & Thurne AB

career.occupational_title: Responsible for Building and Organizing the Technical Department
